member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource
member.summary: Event source based logger to log different events.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.Logger
member.summary: Static logger that is exposed externally. An external application or framework can hook up a listener to this event source to log data in a custom way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.ShowPII
member.summary: Flag which indicates whether or not PII is shown in logs. False by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.LogCompleteSecurityArtifact
member.summary: Flag which indicates whether or not complete is shown in logs when is set to true. False by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.HiddenPIIString
member.summary: String that is used in place of any arguments to log messages if the 'ShowPII' flag is set to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.HeaderWritten
member.summary: Indicates whether or the log message header (contains library version, date/time, and PII debugging information) has been written.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource._versionLogMessage
member.summary: The log message that indicates the current library version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource._dateLogMessage
member.summary: The log message that indicates the date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource._piiOffLogMessage
member.summary: The log message that is shown when PII is off.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource._piiOnLogMessage
member.summary: The log message that is shown when PII is off.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.WriteAlways(System.String)
member.summary: Writes an event log by using the provided string argument and current UTC time. No level filtering is done on the event.
member.param: The log message.
member.remarks: No level filtering.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.WriteAlways(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an event log by using the provided string argument, current UTC time and the provided arguments list.
member.param: The log message.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.

member.summary: Writes a verbose event log by using the provided string argument and current UTC time.
member.param: The log message.

An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelEventSource.LogLevel
member.summary: Minimum log level to log events. Default is Warning.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelTelemetryUtil
member.summary: Provides a way to add and remove telemetry data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelTelemetryUtil.ClientSku
member.summary: Get the string that represents the client SKU.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelTelemetryUtil.ClientVer
member.summary: Get the string that represents the client version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelTelemetryUtil.AddTelemetryData(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a key and its value to the collection of telemetry data.
member.param: The name of the telemetry.
The value of the telemetry.
member.returns: true if the key is successfully added; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.IdentityModelTelemetryUtil.RemoveTelemetryData(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a key and its value from the collection of telemetry data.
member.param: The name of the telemetry.
member.returns: true if the key is successfully removed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.ISafeLogSecurityArtifact
member.summary: Interface that provides an unsafe method to log a security artifact.
member.remarks: SecurityToken and encoded token are considered as SecurityArtifacts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.ISafeLogSecurityArtifact.UnsafeToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the complete security artifact. This may include sensitive information and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext
member.summary: A context class that can be used to store work per request to aid with debugging.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new with the default activityId.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Instantiates a new with an activityId.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.ActivityId
member.summary: Gets or set a that will be used in the call to EventSource.SetCurrentThreadActivityId before logging.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.CaptureLogs
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean controlling if logs are written into the context. Useful when debugging.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.DebugId
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that helps with setting breakpoints when debugging.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.Logs
member.summary: The collection of logs associated with a request. Use to control capture.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LoggerContext.PropertyBag
member.summary: Gets or sets an that enables custom extensibility scenarios.

A callback function to log the security artifact safely.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.LogMessages
member.summary: Log messages and codes for Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.NonPII
member.summary: An internal structure that is used to mark an argument as NonPII. Arguments wrapped with a NonPII structure will be considered as NonPII in the message logging process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.NonPII.Argument
member.summary: Argument wrapped with a structure is considered as NonPII in the message logging process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.NonPII.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an instance of that wraps the .
member.param: An argument that is considered as NonPII.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.NonPII.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the .
member.returns: Null if the is , otherwise calls method of the .

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.SecurityArtifact
member.summary: An internal structure that is used to mark an argument as SecurityArtifact. Arguments wrapped with a SecurityArtifact structure will be considered as a SecurityArtifact in the message logging process.
member.remarks: SecurityToken and encoded token are considered as SecurityArtifacts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.SecurityArtifact.Argument
member.summary: Argument wrapped with a structure is considered as SecurityArtifact in the message logging process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.SecurityArtifact._callback
member.summary: The ToString callback delegate that return a disarmed SecurityArtifact.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.SecurityArtifact.#ctor(System.Object,System.Func{System.Object,System.String})
member.summary: Creates an instance of that wraps the .
member.param: An argument that is considered as SecurityArtifact.
A ToString callback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.SecurityArtifact.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the .
member.returns: Null if the is , otherwise calls method of the .

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener
member.summary: Event listener that writes logs to a file or a fileStream provided by user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener.DefaultLogFileName
member.summary: Name of the default log file, excluding its path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of that writes logs to text file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of that writes logs to text file.
member.param: location of the file where log messages will be written.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener.#ctor(System.IO.StreamWriter)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of that writes logs to text file.
member.param: StreamWriter where logs will be written.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener.OnEventWritten(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventWrittenEventArgs)
member.summary: Called whenever an event has been written by an event source for which the event listener has enabled events.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging.TextWriterEventListener.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires dynamic access to code that is not referenced statically, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when removing unreferenced code from an application.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires unreferenced code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute
member.summary: Suppresses reporting of a specific rule violation, allowing multiple suppressions on a single code artifact.
member.remarks: is different than in that it doesn't have a . So it is always preserved in the compiled assembly.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the category of the tool and the identifier for an analysis rule.
member.param: The category for the attribute.
The identifier of the analysis rule the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Category
member.summary: Gets the category identifying the classification of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property describes the tool or tool analysis category for which a message suppression attribute applies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.CheckId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the analysis tool rule to be suppressed.
member.remarks: Concatenated together, the and properties form a unique check identifier.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified member types.
member.param: The types of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets the which specifies the type of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes
member.summary:
Specifies the types of members that are dynamically accessed.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.None
member.summary: Specifies no members.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicParameterlessConstructor
member.summary: Specifies the default, parameterless public constructor.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicConstructors
member.summary: Specifies all public constructors.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicConstructors
member.summary: Specifies all non-public constructors.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicMethods
member.summary: Specifies all public methods.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicMethods
member.summary: Specifies all non-public methods.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicFields
member.summary: Specifies all public fields.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicFields
member.summary: Specifies all non-public fields.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicNestedTypes
member.summary: Specifies all public nested types.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicNestedTypes
member.summary: Specifies all non-public nested types.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicProperties
member.summary: Specifies all public properties.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicProperties
member.summary: Specifies all non-public properties.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicEvents
member.summary: Specifies all public events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicEvents
member.summary: Specifies all non-public events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.Interfaces
member.summary: Specifies all interfaces implemented by the type.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.All
member.summary: Specifies all members.
